title: misc/vim/plugin/godoc.vim fails for packages like "somedomain.com/user-with-dashes/package"
body:
by **tobias.columbus**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Install any github.com package, say "github.com/nsf/termbox-go"
2. Type ":Godoc github.com/nsf/termbox-go" while editing some go file with vim

What is the expected output?
A split window with the documentation of the package 

What do you see instead?
No documentation for ...

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
doesn't matter

Which operating system are you using?
doesn't matter

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go1 and go1.0.2

Please provide any additional information below.
The vim Godoc function deletes all '.' and all '-' characters prior to actually calling
godoc. Patch attached.
Attachments: 1. godoc.vim.patch (344 bytes)
